Docs.summary: Describes how a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup"> control animates when it opens.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To specify a type of animation for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup> control, set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup.PopupAnimation%2A> property to one of the enumeration values.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.PopupAnimation Fade = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True control gradually appears, or fades in. This effect is created by increasing the opacity of the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True window over time.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.PopupAnimation None = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.PopupAnimation Scroll = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True control scrolls from the upper-left corner of its parent. If the screen does not provide enough room to allow the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True default behavior, the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True scrolls from the lower-right corner instead.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.PopupAnimation Slide = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True control slides down or up into place. By default, a T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True slides down. However, if the screen does not provide enough room for the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True to slide down, it slides up instead.
